title.narrative: Support to the development of the Masterplan for Hydraulic Works

description.narrative: Vietnam Prime Minister requested MARD (Decision #120) to prepare the Hydraulic work masterplan for the Mekong Delta, to be based on the new law. MARD assigned its Directorate of Water Resources (DWR) to urgently draft this masterplan. This masterplan would provide input for the integrated masterplan of the entire Mekong Delta to be developed under a World Bank funded project. This is one of the specific tasks of MARD in the Action plan to implement the Government Resolution #120 on Sustainable Development of the Mekong Delta to response to Climate Change. MARD is assigned to review the existing master plan for irrigation and prevention of natural disasters up to 2-30, with a vision to 2050 to ensure that fits within the new context, to mitigate damages caused by natural disasters, to proactively respond to the most unfavourable scenario; to develop a scheme on modernization of the irrigation system to support the transformation and sustainable agricultural development in ecological sub-zones along the direction of diversification of resources and modes of implementation, with attention paid to promote public-private partnership (PPP). The advice of Dutch experts would be highly appreciated. This fits well within the Strategic Partnership Arrangement on Water Management and Climate Change that Vietnam and the Netherlands have signed. It also fits in the framework agreement elaborated by RVO.RVO requested a team of two experts to prepare and execute a scoping mission to identify possibilities for cooperation between the Netherlands and DWR regarding masterplan for the Mekong Delta. The primary focus was to advise on a realistic scope of the Masterplan for Hydraulic work, the scope of input studies needed for the Masterplan, their research methodologies, as well as on DWR’s work plan to fulfil their task to write the Masterplan. The initial focus was on advising them the way forward from the starting position where they are now. This assignment falls within and is financed by the Partners for Water program. This project is conducted in cooperation with: Climate Sense and the Government of Vietnam.
